2. If a tire suddenly blows out while you are driving, you should:
column10: slow down gradually and brake lightly.

column2: 3. This road sign means:

8. Fines for speeding are tripled in work and school zones.
9. Bicyclists must:
column4: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column6: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column8: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column10: remain near the left edge of the road.

column2: 10. Distracted driving:
column4: is only dangerous for inexperienced drivers.
column6: causes the driver to react more slowly to hazards.
column10: usually causes the driver to drive slower.

column2: 11. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column10: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 12. When approaching someone using a white cane or guide dog, drivers should:
column6: come to a complete stop and invite them to take the right-of-way.
column8: slow down and be prepared to stop.
column10: yield the right-of-way only if the blind person is on the right.

column2: 13. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
14. When passing another vehicle, you should:
column4: check your mirrors and blind spots.
column8: assume the other vehicle will maintain a constant speed.
column10: drive at the same speed as the vehicle you are passing.

column2: 15. Flashing arrow panels are used in work zones:
column4: to guide drivers into certain traffic lanes.
column6: to tell drivers that they must pull onto the shoulder of the road and stop.

column2: 16. Which shape is a warning sign?

18. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column6: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column10: The driver can legally pass red lights.

column2: 19. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: wait for the next green light.
column6: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column8: enter the intersection and then stop.
column10: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.

column2: 20. A road is likely to be most slippery:
column6: when tire marks have been left by other vehicles.
column8: when icy and the temperature is near freezing.
